1.post_text:
Thank you for your overwhelming support everyone - our Hello Kitty Bubbly World Collector’s Sets are now sold out! We hope you’ve enjoyed this new way of collecting and we’re always working to serve you better.

The adorable Hello Kitty Bubbly World series is now available at our restaurants* for a limited period, and this week we are featuring Hello Kitty Bubbly Kerokerokeroppi! Available strictly while stocks last.

*Excludes McDonald’s Drive Thrus, McCafé, McDelivery and our restaurants at KK Hospital and Tampines Interchange Kiosk. 
Terms and Conditions apply. 

You can also donate your meals to low-income families through The Straits Times School Pocket Money Fund. For more details, please visit our Hello Kitty Bubbly World page at www.mcdonalds.com.sg

Snap a photo for a chance to win Hello Kitty Bubbly World Postcards! To participate, upload a creative photo of yourself with just one of our exclusive 2 feet Hello Kitty Bubbly World display on Instagram with the hashtag #mcdbubblyworld and #mcd(location).

3.post_text:
Hello Kitty Fact #1: Despite everyone calling her Hello Kitty, her name is actually Kitty White! 
 
Today we’re launching the first of our Hello Kitty Bubbly World plush toy series – Hello Kitty Bubbly Kerokerokeroppi! 
 
Each Hello Kitty Bubbly World plush toy is priced at $4.95 with purchase of an Extra Value Meal™. Customers can buy up to a maximum of 4 plush toys per store visit, while stocks last! 
 
*Excludes McDonald’s Drive Thrus, McCafé, McDelivery and our restaurants at KK Hospital and Tampines Interchange Kiosk. 
 
Terms and Conditions apply. You can also donate your meals to low income families through The Straits Times School Pocket Money Fund. For more details, please visit our Hello Kitty Bubbly World page at www.mcdonalds.com.sg

4.post_text:
Hello Kitty Bubbly World plush toys are available for purchase in stores* tomorrow from 11 am onwards!
 
1 new design will be launched every Monday at 11am for the next 6 weeks and we are starting with Hello Kitty Bubbly Kerokerokeroppi tomorrow. Each Hello Kitty plush toy is available at $4.95 with purchase of an Extra Value Meal™ and each customer can buy up to a maximum of 4 plush toys per store visit, while stocks last.
 
*Excludes McDonald’s Drive Thrus, McCafé, McDelivery and our restaurants at KK Hospital and Tampines Interchange Kiosk.

Terms and Conditions apply. You can also donate your meals to low-income families through The Straits Times School Pocket Money Fund. For more details, please visit our Hello Kitty Bubbly World page at www.mcdonalds.com.sg

5.post_text:
Meet William Patz (right), the Programme Manager of ESPZEN Soccer School, who will be leading the inaugural McDonald’s Football Clinic in June!

The former Manchester United Youth Coach holds multiple certifications in coaching, including a UEFA ‘B’ License Coaching Certificate and Coach Mentor Certification by United Kingdom Football Association, and he is raring to bring his international coaching experience to the young talents at the football clinic. 

Here’s your chance for your child to be part of the McDonald’s Football Clinic. Register now at: http://www.mcdonalds.com.sg/world-cup/football-clinic/ 

Registration is free and there are still a few places up for grabs, on a first-come-first-served basis.

8.post_text:
Dear Customers,

Thank you for your support of the Hello Kitty Bubbly World promotion. 

We will be reopening the website for orders in approximately 30 minutes time. All confirmation emails have now been sent to customers with successful transactions, please check your emails. If you have not received this email, your transaction was unsuccessful and we recommend you visit the site and try again.

Due to large numbers of customers who may concurrently be logged into the store, we may temporarily halt new orders at different times to ensure a smoother experience. As these orders are completed, we will gradually release any remaining plush toys for order. 

Thank you for your understanding.

When you put while stocks last, all interested people would chiong to your website on 23 Apr, 11am trying to order as they scared anytime would OOS! If your intention is to avoid long q at the restaurants, you should just open up 1 whole week of online selling, stating the start and end date/time, & assured everyone who ordered during this period would get their order. Any balance from online stock, then you sell through the restaurants.

If you can't do it properly, might as well just let people q cos now Mac is showing that you are not just not capable of handling the crowds at the restaurants but you also can't handle the online sale, so what are you good at? People complained about the q & now add on with people complaining about how you handle your online sale, double attack, haha...

9.post_text:
Dear Customers,

Thank you for your overwhelming response to our Hello Kitty Promotion. To ease traffic we are temporarily suspending new orders. We will resume sales as soon as possible.

Thank you for your patience.

12.post_text:
The Hello Kitty Bubbly World characters are almost here! Here’s how you can get your hands on these exclusive collectibles:
 
1) From 11am on 23 April, a Collectors’ Set will be available for online purchase, while stocks last. The set is priced at $80 and contains:
-  All 6 Hello Kitty Bubbly World plush toys
-  A 40th Anniversary Certificate
-  Six McDonald’s Extra Value Meal™ vouchers valued at $5 each.
Price includes delivery by Speedpost or self-collection at a Singpost POPstation.
 
2) Individual characters will be available at our restaurants* from 28 April, 11 am. Priced at $4.95 each with purchase of an Extra Value Meal™, 1 new design will be available every Monday at 11am for 6 weeks! Each customer can buy up to a maximum of 4 Hello Kitty Bubbly World plush toys per store visit. While stocks last.
 
*Excludes McDonald’s Drive Thrus, McCafé, McDelivery and our restaurants at KK Hospital and Tampines Interchange Kiosk.
 
To minimise food wastage, we are working on options to donate meals to charity and will announce more details in due course.
 
Terms and Conditions apply. For more details, please visit our Hello Kitty Bubbly World page at www.mcdonalds.com.sg

comments.message:
Damn hot, because

Topic: The most humiliating meal I ever had in my life.

I've been eating Macdonald's for the past 20 odd years of my life. In all these years, I've had my fair share of ups and downs with Macdonald's. I thought I had already experienced the worse from Madconald's the previous time when you sent me wrong items for my order, but today was an eye-opener. Your mistakes, your horrible servitude, you stupidity knows no limits.

Let me share with you a humiliating and offensive moment of my life today, 17 April 2014, from 1.10pm-1.40pm. I was having lunch with my friend at Macdonald's The Metropolis Branch. I know that you guys have some Big bosses making a trip to your branch from the incident that I am about to describe. 

At about 1.30pm, one of your staff, a female indian, approached me (wearing stipe top and an apron saying McCafe, I suppose she's in charge of the McCafe counter in your branch) and told me, (and here are exactly or along-the-line of what she said): "Hi Sir, are you done with your meal, because our big bosses are here, can I clear your trays for you?" （Hinting me to go away, not just simply clearing trays to make the place neater)

For a moment I was thinking, there are some customers waiting to eat, and it's lunch time, so, I guess she's just being helpful. But WAIT! She said big bosses of hers. Those big bosses are a group of Caucasians and one of them is wearing blazer (might even be the CEO of the company) and at that point of time, I felt deeply humiliated and offended on the following basis:

1) ME as a CUSTOMER should have the priority for the seat, because it is my friend and I who are paying for yours and your bosses' salaries! By telling me to give up seats to your Big Bosses just so for you to "Wayang" is totally humiliating, it's a though you are telling me that "hey, I don't give a damn if you are a customer, because my big bosses are here and I need to show off to them how important they are to me, so it is just right that you just SCRAM". This is so humiliating 

2) If you are expecting some BIG SHOTS to arrive, please have the IQ to put a "reserved" sign on tables just to block out seats for them, I can't believe how stupid you guys are.

3) If I were you, I would have just said: "Sir, we have quite a lot of customers waiting for seats as it is lunch time, do you want me to clear the trays for you? Thank you very much."

4) We CUSTOMERS are paying so much for a meal, and you can't even send your employee for a proper customer relations course?

5) I DONT GIVE A DAMN AT ALL THAT YOUR BIG BOSSES ARE HERE, DON'T RELATE YOUR PROBLEMS TO ME WHEN YOU DON'T MANAGE YOUR SCHEDULE PROPERLY.

To conclude, today's lunch was the unhappiest meal of my life and I will make sure this incident gets enough media coverage, starting with Facebook until I get a pleasing response from Macdonald's
